title: Get report(s)
name: GetAll

Parameter.description: Id of a report in case single report needs to be viewed.
Filter results by longitude (only if latitude is set). Center of circle.
Filter results by latitude (only if longitude is set). Center of circle.
Filter results by radius(in meters, only if longitude and latitude is set). Radius of circle.

examples.title: Success-Response-Multiple:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
[{
    id: String,
    title: String,
    location: {
        long: Number,
        lat: Number
    },
    categoryId: [String],
    image_url: String,
    description: String,
    profileId: String,
    date: String,
    votes:[{
        profileId:String,
        date:String,
        vote:Boolean
    }],
    approved: Boolean,
    flagged: Boolean
}]

examples.title: Success-Response-Single:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    id: String,
    title: String,
    location: {
        long: Number,
        lat: Number
    },
    categoryId: [String],
    image_url: String,
    description: String,
    profileId: String,
    date: String,
    votes:[{
        profileId:String,
        date:String,
        vote:Boolean
    }],
    approved: Boolean,
    flagged: Boolean
}

Success 200.description: Array containing category ids of a report
If true indicates that report is approved
If true indicates that report is reported/flagged
.userId Id of user who voted on this report

description: Public access and registered users receive only filtered results (approved,!flagged). Admins and advanced users have more options to filter the results. Location filter is available for public. Returns single report in case id is specified.

title: Add Favourite Place
name: AddFavouritePlace

Parameter.description: String indicating users' time preference towards a place.

description: Adds place to user favourites by id.

examples.title: Missing or wrong id:

title: Add role
name: AddRole
description: Adds role to a user if the role is not 'superadmin'. Addition of 'admin' requires superadmin rights.

Success 200.description: If true, then username is already taken.

title: Copy Profile
name: CopyProfile

Parameter.description: If true sets the image provided by social media to be user image.

Success 200.description: If true, the profile was copied successfully

description: Adds social media profile that user has logged with to profile property. (Optional) Sets user image to one provided by social media. Returns error in case user has not logged through social network.

title: Get All
name: GetAll

Success 200.description: Users gender. String, not boolean? We support apaches?
.placeId Id of the place as reference

Array containing links to social profiles of the user(Facebook, Twitter and etc.)* Note! Currently there is no way of linking multiple social profiles to 1 user. Even though if provider and link will be added, user won't be able to log in from more than 1 of the profiles. Ask Nikita more about this topic if you have any questions.
.provider Social Provider (Facebook, Twitter, Google and etc.)
Date indicating last action of the user?
Array containing log in and log out times bound to certain places

examples.title: Success-Response:

description: Returns Array of json objects containing users information. Requires Login.

title: Get roles
name: GetRoles
description: Returns array of Strings, that are roles for the specified user (Admin only). If id was not specified the users' own roles are returned.

title: Get user
name: GetUser

Parameter.description: User id that is to be returned. If not provided, users own information is returned.

Success 200.description: Users gender. String, not boolean? We support apaches?
.placeId Id of the place as reference

Array containing links to social profiles of the user(Facebook, Twitter and etc.)* Note! Currently there is no way of linking multiple social profiles to 1 user. Even though if provider and link will be added, user won't be able to log in from more than 1 of the profiles. Ask Nikita more about this topic if you have any questions.
.provider Social Provider (Facebook, Twitter, Google and etc.)
Date indicating last action of the user?
Array containing log in and log out times bound to certain places

examples.title: Success-Response:

description: Returns single json object containing user own information if no id was provided. Returns single json object containing user information if id was provided. Requires Login.

title: Is Admin
name: IsAdmin
description: Checks if user is admin. Used for gui manipulation.

title: Is Advanced
name: IsAdvanced
description: Checks if user is advanced. Used for gui manipulation.

title: Remove Favourite Place
name: RemoveFavouritePlace
description: Removes the place from favourites if it finds matching. Does not check for validity of id. Does not say if any place was removed.

title: Remove role
name: RemoveRole

Parameter.description: Role that needs to be removed from user

description: Removes role from a user if the role is not 'superadmin'. Removing of 'admin' requires superadmin rights.

title: Set username
name: SetUsername

Success 200.description: If true, the username was set successfully

description: User can set a username if one is available and he doesn't have it yet. Admin can set his own and other users usernames, if the specified username is available.

examples.title: Success-Response:

description: Updates the user with specified parameters. Not every parameter is allowed to be updated. The ones that are listed are allowed. User doesn't have to specify his own id, if id is omitted then users own profile is updated. Only admin can update another users profile. Returns updated profile on success.
